intro: Exocarya montivaga, commonly known as the mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. Its leaves are typically large, palmately lobed, and covered in a fine, fuzzy texture. Exocarya montivaga thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in cloud forests and alpine meadows.
